title: Store fields used in MBQL cards in QueryField
body:
Two commits (easier to read them separately, I think):

First is searching for fields inside pMBQL, and the main reason I'm not doing that directly to MBQL is to resolve all the nested cards. Now that I'm writing this comment I wonder if it even makes sense to do so? Fields will be marked stale on the nested cards by themselves?... I need a second opinion here, code could be smaller (and much faster) if we don't do that.

Second is just migration change - thankfully it's not in release yet, so I think no harm just reusing the same code.

Resolves #41400

title: Account for non-hydrated properties in GET /api/dashboard
body:
Follow up on #41311

### Description

It turns out that [GET `/api/dashboard` does not hydrate](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/347c5ef47ce56bfbefc002b43607c14656eae17f/src/metabase/api/dashboard.clj#L62) all dashboard properties like [GET `/api/dashboard/:id` does](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/347c5ef47ce56bfbefc002b43607c14656eae17f/src/metabase/api/dashboard.clj#L93-L104)

### How to verify

Use `useListDashboardsQuery` somewhere, e.g.
```tsx
const { data } = useListDashboardsQuery();
```

There should be no error in JS console. Previously it would throw an error that `dashboard.dashcards` is undefined.

title: show an error when too many series
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41609 ### Description Describe the overall approach and the problem being solved. ### How to verify Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected. 1. New question -> Products -> 2. Group by Created At and Title 3. Reorder X-axis columns so that the Title will be used as a breakout dimension since it has >100 values 4. Ensure the chart shows an error. In dev mode it is "A cross-origin error was thrown. React doesn't have access to the actual error object in development. See https://reactjs.org/link/crossorigin-error for more information." ‚Äî we need to fix this separately. In the console you can see the message is correct. ### Demo ### Checklist - [-] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR ‚Äî covered by e2e specs that caught this

title: Dates Binned by Week Export Formatting Matches App
body:
Fixes: #41492 and #41639

Before, the dates binned by week would be formatted as follows in CSV and JSON exports:

`Week 1 - 2024`

But that doesn't match the App's format of a Date Range:

`January 1, 2024 - January 7, 2024`

So, now the exports will apply formatting in this same way.

Dates binned by :hour were missing the Day, and that is also fixed.

Note that a second bug (#41616) exists on the Frontend preventing the column formatting being applied in the app. This is frontend only, and the csv and json exports will match the column formatting settings (eg. abbreviated dates and alternative separators will be used in the export).

title: Fix e2e-tests-visualizations-charts-ee
body:
- Fixes E2E spec e2e-tests-visualizations-charts-ee in https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40930

---
**CI Blockers:**
- `visualization-charts/waterfall.cy.spec.js: "should work with time-series data"`: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41550
- `e2e/test/scenarios/visualizations-charts/maps.cy.spec.js: "should apply brush filters by dragging map"`: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41605
- `e2e/test/scenarios/visualizations-charts/line_chart.cy.spec.js: "should display an error message when there are more series than the chart supports"`:https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41609
- `e2e/test/scenarios/visualizations-charts/line_chart.cy.spec.js: "should be possible to update/change label for an empty row value (metabase#12128)"`: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41610
- `e2e/test/scenarios/visualizations-charts/line_chart.cy.spec.js: "should show label for empty value series breakout (metabase#32107)" and "should not drop the chart legend (metabase#4995)""`: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41611
- `e2e/test/scenarios/visualizations-charts/line_chart.cy.spec.js: "custom expression names (metabase#16249-1)" and "regular column names (metabase#16249-2)"`: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41612
- `e2e/test/scenarios/visualizations-charts/bar_chart.cy.spec.js: "supports up to 100 series (metabase#28796)"`:https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41609

title: Reset mapping after change of operator for native questions
body:
closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41397

### Description

We need to reset mapping for native questions when there is no mapping using a new operator.

we calculate mappings for every dashcard, so dashcards already has all the information and can trigger mapping reset

### Demo


https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/125459446/699fd277-6288-4c1d-8fcc-643f89e67aab

title: Add table of models to the "Browse models" page
body:
Adds a table of models to the **Browse models** page.

![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/130925/13b4f216-3e72-444e-85fa-07c5ab8af9cf)

Figma: https://www.figma.com/file/hubkgafXKo4wcBeTAbJ4vh/Browsing-Models-Exploration?type=design&node-id=252-22078&mode=design&t=Gmk1MAN7hCTDKM34-4

This PR also removes previously existing tab logic. Previously, the logic for retrieving models and retrieving databases was housed in a high-level component, BrowseApp. I moved the models-related logic into the component that displays the models and the database-related logic into the component that displays the databases.

For now, this table is pretty simple. We'll be iterating on it.

title: Drop clj linting and formatting from pre-commit hooks
body:
[context](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C05MPF0TM3L/p1713462678329479?thread_ts=1712850168.176149&cid=C05MPF0TM3L) 

### Description

It caused problems as lint-staged stashes files and if developer is not familiar with the mechanism, he thinks that his work is lost. To avoid confusion we remove this git hook

### How to verify

if you change any clj file and commit it, no files are stashed and unstashed

title: Remove driver-specific code from `sync-fields!`
body:
Follow up in epic: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39986

This PR is a refactoring similar to [Use fk-metadata instead of table-fk-metadata everywhere](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41375). 

Instead of having driver-dependent code in `metabase.sync.sync-metadata.fields/sync-fields!` which branches on whether a driver implements `describe-fields` or not, we now handle that branching in `metabase.sync.fetch-metadata/fields-metadata`.

The main benefits:
- consistency in approach between `sync-fields!` and `sync-fks!`
- the complexity of having two methods to get field metadata (`describe-fields` and `describe-table`) are isolated in `metabase.sync.fetch-metadata`. The `fetch-metadata` namespace is the only namespace that needs to be updated if `describe-table` is replaced with `describe-fields`.
- That makes it easier to deprecate `driver/describe-table` and replace it with `driver/describe-fields` in the future.

By making this change, I also caught and fixed a (hypothetical) bug: if there was driver that doesn't support `schemas` but did support `describe-fields`, sync would fail. This is the case for the only (officially supported) database that supports `describe-fields` (redshift), but it might not be so in the future.
author: calherries
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Convert EmbeddingContext to Sdk Store slice
body:
Removes anything related to Embedding context and moves everything into an SDK store slice. I needed to do some refactoring because of some typescript errors, but it works with the local SDK setup.

I've also added `useSdkSelector` and `useSdkDispatch` to help us with type-safe interactions with Redux. Let me know if we should keep these, I think they will come in useful in the future. There's also other instances where we should probably replace regular useSelector/useDispatch calls with these selectors, but for now I think it's ok.

title: Fix null characters in JSON breaking CardRevisionAddType for postgres
body:
Fixes the escalation https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40835

### The problem
The `CardRevisionAddType` migration was converting text to JSONB before manipulating it using JSON functions. The text may contain null characters which are not allowed when converting text to JSONB. Here's a relevant resource on JSONB: https://p2d2.cz/files/jsonb-silver-bullet.pdf

### The solution
In the postgres migration, we now:
1. replace `\u0000` with a randomly generated UUID 
2. update the JSONB, as before
3. convert JSONB to text
4. replace the UUID with `\u0000` again

title: Rework view-data migration for efficiency
body:
This PR restructures the SQL migration which populates the new `view-data` permission in order to avoid a hot spot which was causing stats to timeout when deploying the migration.

Specifically, when we're detecting whether to set `legacy-no-self-service` for a particular group & table combination, we need to check these conditions:
* If any user in the group is also in another group with:
 * `block` data permissions for the DB
 * a connection impersonation policy for the DB 
 * a sandboxing policy for the table

Previously, this was happening in the `WHERE` clause of a cross-join between the `permissions_group` and `metabase_table`, which turned out to be very inefficient. The cross join itself wasn't a huge problem, which is why earlier testing didn't expose this, but adding these conditions slows it down significantly.

I've restructured this script into several distinct operations:
1. First, we insert a `view-data` permission row for every existing `data-access` row that was set on an individual table. To check whether `legacy-no-self-service` should be set, we join `data_permissions` against a subquery that `UNION`s the relevant columns from `data_permissions`, `sandboxes` and `connection_impersonations`. This is a much faster process.
2. Then, we look for any tables in a DB which are set to all the same values and insert a DB-level row with that value.
3. Then we set DB-level `view-data` permissions for any DBs that previously had DB-level `data-access` permissions. This is unchanged from the previous implementation because it wasn't seeing the same performance issues.
4. Finally, we delete any table-level rows which also have DB-level rows set. (This is necessary as clean-up from step 2)

I've also had to split the `view_data` migration into two versions, one for postgres & h2 and one for mysql & mariadb due to syntax compatibility issues.

**Timing data**
This data is collected from running both the `view_data` and the (unchanged) `create_queries` migrations on a local Postgres app DB populated with a dump of data from stats. tl;dr: I've cut the runtime down from 2 minutes to 3 seconds.

Previous migration:
```
metabase=# \i resources/migrations/permissions/view_data.sql
INSERT 0 0
Time: 129350.615 ms (02:09.351)
INSERT 0 435
Time: 32.590 ms
metabase=# \i resources/migrations/permissions/create_queries.sql
INSERT 0 424
Time: 21.807 ms
INSERT 0 16796
Time: 227.459 ms

```

New migration: 
```
metabase=# \i resources/migrations/permissions/view_data.sql
INSERT 0 16796
Time: 3844.136 ms (00:03.844)
INSERT 0 11
Time: 6.521 ms
INSERT 0 424
Time: 175.322 ms
DELETE 16796
Time: 22.087 ms
metabase=# \i resources/migrations/permissions/create_queries.sql
INSERT 0 424
Time: 21.439 ms
INSERT 0 16796
Time: 218.129 ms

```
author: noahmoss
labels: [('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Notebook text extraction shortcut
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41504


### Description

Adds the extract column functionality to the notebook editor.

### Steps to reproduce

1. New Question ‚Üí Orders
2. Add new column
3. Custom Expression
4. Extract columns
5. Pick a column to extract and pick an extraction and click Done

Make sure the:
- name of the column makes sense
- the expression makes sense

### Demo


https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1250185/31b6a3f3-c193-4070-8b4e-d0a6d24ab089

title: add withUndos option to renderWithProviders to render Undos during ‚Ä¶
body:
### Description

This will allow us to test toast/undos easily in jest tests.

I added it behind a flag to not render the component when we don't need it, even though it's a small component we have a lot of tests

### How to verify

[This test](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41575/files#diff-bfaa39e7d0397935ebf6b7a70dad5261af7438cd0a8e2ec185094e537f4e05efR211-R213) in a PR with this code should pass
author: npretto
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]
comments_list:
[{'comment_id': 2064041211, 'issue_id': 2250774039, 'author': 'npretto', 'body': "> I like the approach, but I just have a thought that maybe we should not do anything more with `undos` until we extract `toast`/`notification` out of `undos`. Now in a lot of E2E tests, we call `undoToast()` while what we're actually testing is testing the toast notification.
> 
> I mean it is technically correct since we `dispatch(addUndo(xxx))` when we want to show the notification. It just feels wrong extending this notion of `undo`s that mostly are toast notifications.
> 
> In a perfect world, I'd expect `toast` or `notification` or whatever we're gonna call it behave similar to undo, but doesn't allow the ability to undo things since that's not what it's made for.

Maybe we can rename the flag to `withNotifications` so that the same flag can enable both when we'll split them? It should make migrating things easier as it shouldn't break tests when migrating them", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 18, 14, 37, 52, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2066761528, 'issue_id': 2250774039, 'author': 'npretto', 'body': '@iethree since you approved, would you be ok with the change from `withUndos` to `withNotifications` as suggested above?', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 19, 15, 0, 1, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2066778071, 'issue_id': 2250774039, 'author': 'iethree', 'body': "> @iethree since you approved, would you be ok with the change from `withUndos` to `withNotifications` as suggested above?

either one sounds fine to me. either way we'll want to make some changes when we make notifications more sane down the road (https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/38832)", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 19, 15, 9, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2066822671, 'issue_id': 2250774039, 'author': 'npretto', 'body': "I'll leave it with the current name then just to make sure I'm not adding an abstraction which can be wrong soon, we can decide when we do that change if we want to merge the two into one flag or not (it will probably depend if we plan on migrating everything or not, and how)", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 19, 15, 35, 2, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2066823147, 'issue_id': 2250774039, 'author': 'github-actions[bot]', 'body': '@npretto Did you forget to add a milestone to the issue for this PR? _[When and where should I add a milestone?](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Metabase-Branching-Strategy-6eb577d5f61142aa960a626d6bbdfeb3?pvs=4#3dea255ffa3b4f74942a227844e889fa)_', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 19, 15, 35, 20, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]
comment_thread:
npretto (Issue Creator) on (2024-04-18 14:37:52 UTC): Maybe we can rename the flag to `withNotifications` so that the same flag can enable both when we'll split them? It should make migrating things easier as it shouldn't break tests when migrating them

npretto (Issue Creator) on (2024-04-19 15:00:01 UTC): @iethree since you approved, would you be ok with the change from `withUndos` to `withNotifications` as suggested above?

iethree on (2024-04-19 15:09:45 UTC): either one sounds fine to me. either way we'll want to make some changes when we make notifications more sane down the road (https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/38832)

npretto (Issue Creator) on (2024-04-19 15:35:02 UTC): I'll leave it with the current name then just to make sure I'm not adding an abstraction which can be wrong soon, we can decide when we do that change if we want to merge the two into one flag or not (it will probably depend if we plan on migrating everything or not, and how)

title: Add prefix to CSS custom properties
body:
Closes #40128

### Description

Add prefix `mb` to all CSS custom properties. Funnily enough, if you look at the commits in this PR. I actually renamed all the CSS custom properties even if they're not eventually emitted to HTML (most of them are removed by PostCSS). I really did all that before realizing they're not even emitted to HTML, so they shouldn't be migrated just to make the code as concise as possible.

### How to verify
This touches a lot of places. Just playing around with the app and nothing should look differently.

### Checklist

- [ ] ~Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR~ only CSS changes
author: WiNloSt

title: Migrate DatasetFieldMetadataSidebar to new Forkmik components
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41539

### Description
Shift the Sidebar form (and it's components) to use the Form Provider. Changes to end user should be minimal.

### How to verify
e2e tests should confirm functionality is the same, but a few things to test:
- The Display Name field should always show the OG column name
- When working with a model made from a native query, mapping the field to a column should populate the form with the columns values
- Fields that are foreign keys should allow you to specify their target fields

### Demo

_Upload a demo video or before/after screenshots if sensible or remove the section_

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Be more consistent with borders and avoid double borders
body: The `AccordionList` component is used in a lot of places, often with ad-hoc ways of creating different sections and headings. We recently tried adding borders to sections, actions and headers to clarify what content belongs together. However, due to the inconsistency in how the component gets used, some visual bugs have popped up, like double borders or missing borders. For example: some components use an empty section to denote an action. We want this action button to receive borders. Other components however render items as sections that should not receive borders. So, without more context it is impossible to correctly assign borders. This PR: - attempts to be more consistent by relying on CSS sibling selectors to avoid double borders from rendering. - adds missing borders to components that use custom elements in the accordion list - lock this behaviour behind a prop to reduce the blast radius ### After Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41403
author: romeovs
labels: [('visual', 'Run Percy visual testing'), ('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: Bump dompurify
body:
Fix [this alert](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/security/code-scanning/239)

#### How to verify
`dompurify` is an optional dependency for `jspdf` which we used for exporting dashboards to PDF. So testing that dashboards could be exported to PDF should suffice. I tested that it worked on my end.

Yeah, that was probably not the correct way to do it. So what I did was 1. removing this block ``` dompurify@^2.2.0: version "2.5.0" resolved "https://registry.yarnpkg.com/dompurify/-/dompurify-2.5.0.tgz#13b1115d79b9340e6db80b4624653f665885b15f" integrity sha512-5RXhAXSCrKTqt9pSbobT9PVRX+oPpENplTZqCiK1l0ya+ZOzwo9kqsGLbYRsAhzIiLCwKEy99XKSSrqnRTLVcw== ``` 2. ran `yarn` This added that block back as what you see in this PR. But after this, if we run `yarn` again `2.5.0` will turn to `2.2.0` Edited: well IDK, I tested this again. it does seem to set `dompurify@^2.2.0:` correctly. Maybe I manually edited that version to `2.5.0` and accidentally included that ü§¶', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 18, 15, 1, 43, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2065920005, 'issue_id': 2250065501, 'author': 'kamilmielnik', 'body': '@WiNloSt Here's what happens: We use `jspdf@2.5.1` which lists this dependency in their `package.json`: ```json "dompurify": "^2.2.0", ``` We want to bump that, so we need to _map_ the `dompurify@^2.2.0` dependency to `dompurify@2.5.0`, which is exactly what this bit in `yarn.lock` means/does: ``` dompurify@^2.2.0: version "2.5.0" ``` ---- If we had this in `yarn.lock`, then `jspdf` would still use `dompurify@2.2.0`: ``` dompurify@^2.5.0: version "2.5.0" ```', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 19, 7, 20, 38, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2065928111, 'issue_id': 2250065501, 'author': 'WiNloSt', 'body': '> @WiNloSt Here's what happens: > > We use `jspdf@2.5.1` which lists this dependency in their `package.json`: > > ```json > "dompurify": "^2.2.0", > ``` > > We want to bump that, so we need to _map_ the `dompurify@^2.2.0` dependency to `dompurify@2.5.0`, which is exactly what this bit in `yarn.lock` means/does: > > ``` > dompurify@^2.2.0: > version "2.5.0" > ``` > > If we had this in `yarn.lock`, then `jspdf` would still use `dompurify@2.2.0`: > > ``` > dompurify@^2.5.0: > version "2.5.0" > ``` TIL. Thanks for the explanation. I got it now üôè', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 19, 7, 23, 42, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]

title: 41487 SDK plugins system PoC
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41487

### Description

This adds extension point to change click actions in Embedding SDK.

Example usage is here - 
https://github.com/metabase/embedding-sdk-customer-zero/blob/41487-sdk-plugins-example/src/App.tsx#L83

SDK users can filter / update or add click actions for a selected InteractiveQuestion.

Current API is not ideal, as our configuration objects for click actions are rather verbose.

### How to verify

Use this SDK build. 
Try to add custom actions.
Please, provide feedback on how to make the API more eloquent.

### Demo

https://www.loom.com/share/cd028ccc8e6841e3a9256fc59db27992?sid=2406b34d-98ff-4c65-8cb4-c8acfc963799

### Checklist

- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Add a way to update filter type and operator from parameter sidebar
body:
[Epic](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41037)

### Description

Add a way to update filter type and operator from parameter sidebar. 
There are several scenarios covered:

1. Create a dashboard filter

New logic presumes there is only first step to choose a filter type, operator is selected automatically accordingly with "smart defaults" section of the [product doc](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Let-users-change-the-dashboard-filter-type-and-operator-after-creation-514c727bb17c48cc8bad24d91e9423df)



https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/125459446/c51d458f-5ea1-4da7-9cac-6852b342413e



2. Change Filter type 

It should reset all existing mappings and default value


https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/125459446/3dbfad2d-f9b3-4b23-b807-c6b1a9f1d869


3. Change Filter operator

it shouldn't reset all existing mappings, except some cases in SQL questions

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/125459446/7e4be13a-6c1c-4415-93df-9131e7906f1b
author: uladzimirdev

title: Remove db portion of mongo connection string
body:
Closes #38966

_Probable cause_ of the failure is database name containing non encoded chars.

This PR removes the `<database>` portion of Mongo connection string. Authentication is done against database provided with the credentials. This connection string option sets the _default_ database to login ([docs](https://mongodb.github.io/mongo-java-driver/5.0/apidocs/mongodb-driver-core/com/mongodb/ConnectionString.html)).

Existing tests ensure that we are able to execute queries, do sync, etc. without this option set.
author: lbrdnk

title: Use dbname from database details instead of stats returned from Mongo
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/38013

Linked issue is caused by differences in data returned by `stats` command of Mongo single node and sharded cluster deployments. Specifically, database name from command's result was used for further check. As sharded cluster's result has name stored under a different key, `driver/can-connect? :mongo` behaved incorrectly.

The method in question has database name available in db details. Name from details is used now, to avoid convoluting the code with conditional name extraction based on deployment type.

Apart from that, this PR adds Mongo sharded cluster deployment job, containing just one test at the moment. That test, running against the sharded cluster deployment, without the fix in place would fail.

Approach of testing against sharded cluster was discussed in [this slack thread](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C04DN5VRQM6/p1713383985047539).
author: lbrdnk
labels: [('Database/Mongo', None), ('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: [QP, lib] Add expression functions for month, quarter, weekday names
body:
The new expressions `:month-name`, `:quarter-name` and `:day-name`
return the (user localized) names for these units, given the
corresponding number.

For example, 4 yields `"Apr"`, `"Q4"` or `"Wednesday"` respectively.

The `column-extract` drill uses these new expressions, rather than
generating its own `:case` clauses for them.

Part of the follow-up for Extract Column epic #38964.
author: bshepherdson
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

This fixes runtime issue with parsing embedded / public dashboard parameters that represent numbers with leading "0".

title: Move archived items to the trash
body:
This PR is probably too big. Hopefully documenting all the changes made here will make it easier to review and digest. So:

## Migration

Tables with a `collection_id` had `ON DELETE SET NULL` on the foreign key. Since we only deleted collections in testing and development, this didn't really affect anything. But now that we are actually deleting collections in production, it's important that nothing accidentally get moved to the root collection, which is what `SET NULL` actually does.

## Moving things to the Trash

When we get an API request to update the `archived` flag on a card, collection, or dashboard, we either move the item *to* the trash (if `archived` is `true`) or *from* the trash (if `archived` is `false`). We set the `trashed_from_collection_id` flag as appropriate, and use it when restoring an item if possible.

## Permissions changes

Because moving something to the trash by itself would have permissions implications (since permissions are based on the parent collection) we need to change the way permissions are enforced for trashed items.

First, we change the definition of `perms-objects-set-for-parent-collection` so that it returns the permission set for the collection the object was *trashed from*, if it is archived.

Second, when listing objects inside the Trash itself, we need to check permissions to make sure the user can actually read the object - usually, of course, if you can read a collection you can read the contents, but this is not true for the trash so we need to check each one. In this case we're actually a little extra restrictive and only return objects the user can *write*. The reasoning here is that you only really want to browse the Trash to see things you could "act on" - unarchive or permanently delete. So there's no reason to show you things you only have read permissions on.

## Collection API changes

Because previously the Collections API expected archived collections to live anywhere, not just in a single tree based in the Trash, I needed to make some changes to some API endpoints.

### /collection/tree

This endpoint still takes an `exclude-archived` parameter, which defaults to `false`. When it's `false`, we return the entire tree including the Trash collection and archived children. When it's `true`, we exclude the Trash collection (and its subtree) from the results.

### /collection/:id/items

Previously, this endpoint took an `archived` parameter, which defaulted to `false`. Thus it would only return non-archived results. This is a problem, because we want the frontend to be able to ask for the contents of the Trash or an archived subcollection without explicitly asking for archived results. We just want to treat these like normal collections.

The change made to support this was to just default `archived` to the `archived` status of the collection itself. If you're asking for the items in an archived collection, you'll only get archived results. If you're asking for the items in a non-archived collection, you'll only get unarchived results.

This is, for normal collections, the same thing as just returning all results. But see the section on namespaced collections for details on why we needed this slightly awkward default.

### /collection/root/items

No change - this endpoint still takes an `archived` parameter. When `archived=true`, we return the Trash collection, as it is in the root collection. Otherwise, we don't.
author: johnswanson
labels: [('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: [QP, lib] Add new expression functions for host, domain, subdomain
body:
These functions are implemented with hairy regular expressions, and
it's more user-friendly and future-proof to name those functions in MBQL
rather than baking the `regexextract` and regex into the user's query.

It lets us evolve the regexes in the future if we detect a bug, and it
improves the UX since the user sees a meaningful function instead of

    regexextract([My URL Column], "(?<=[@\.])(?!www\.)[^@\.]+(?=\.[^@\.]{1,3}\.[^@\.]+$|\.[^@\.]+$)")

Also refactors the regexes somewhat so that they work for emails as well as URLs, and there's always just one layer of `:regex-match-first`.
Previously this was separated into two steps: URL or email to host, and host to (sub)domain.

Part of the follow-up for Extract Column epic #38964.
author: bshepherdson
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

title: Migrate Entity Copy Modal away from EntityForm
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/35966

### Description
This PR changes the `EntityCopyModal` to render forms directly as components rather than the previous data driven approach that rendered forms from data on the entity. It introduces forms for Copying Questions and Dashboards, which the `EntityCopyModal` will render based on the entity type. I believe a good follow up to this will be to remove the `EntityCopyModal` completely, and just render the modals with the forms in the 3 places that use it. 

This PR also defaults the font of `FormTextInput` and `FormTextarea` components to be bold

### How to verify
Verify that Duplicating Questions (in the query builder) and Dashboards (in Dashboards and Collection views) still works as intended

### Demo
![chrome_2XPh5qlL3R](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1328979/cb9be547-3b9d-41b9-a717-c0c7d859984e)


### Checklist

title: Migration to add `trashed_from_*`
body:
We want to record where things were trashed *from* for two purposes:

- first, we want to be able to put things back if they're "untrashed".

- second, we want to be able to enforce permissions *as if* something is still in its previous location. That is, if we trash a card or a dashboard from Collection A, the permissions of Collection A should continue to apply to the card or dashboard (e.g. in terms of who can view it).

To achieve this, collections get a `trashed_from_location` (paralleling their `location`) and dashboards/cards get a
`trashed_from_collection_id` (paralleling their `collection_id`).
author: johnswanson
labels: [('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Improve test coverage for describe-fks and describe-fields
body:
This PR improves the test coverage around the `describe-fks` and `describe-fields` functions introduced in https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39986

The PR adds these tests:
1. `test/metabase/driver_test.clj` now contains tests for `describe-table`, `describe-fields`, `describe-table-fks` and `describe-fks` that run for every driver. Previously we only had tests for these functions for SQL JDBC drivers that use the default implementations.
2. Extends `sync-fks-and-fields-for-db-test` to test `sync-fields/sync-fields!` and `sync-fields/sync-fks!` for drivers that support foreign keys.

title: Scope HTML styles and CSS custom properties
body:
Epic https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/38811
Sub-task https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41256

### Description

Scope HTML styles and CSS custom properties in `base.module.css`

### How to verify
1. Test that the app style doesn't look weird. The `body` node should contain the same style plus CSS custom properties from `:root`
    ![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/ab8667a2-dc3b-4727-ac44-89be60bdbc17)
2. Test that the [example app](https://github.com/metabase/embedding-sdk-customer-zero/tree/pre-alpha) inherit all the styles from `base.styled.ts` and is scoped under the root SDK div.
    ![Screenshot 2024-04-17 at 10 15 30‚ÄØPM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/7493031b-430c-4d32-8ad5-49bfcbd16224)

    To setup the example app:
    1. I set the dependencies in the example app to the locally built SDK path `"@metabase/embedding-sdk-react": "file:../metabase/resources/embedding-sdk"` üëà change the path to whatever the directory structure on your computer is. In my case, both the example app and metabase repos are on the same level.
    2. Remove `.npmrc`
    4. Run `yarn install-deps && yarn start`

### Checklist

- [ ] ~Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR~ Only change CSS

title: [MBQL lib] Add `column-extractions` to the top level
body:
Column extractions are "canned" expressions based on a column's
type. For example, we might extract the weekday from a temporal column,
or the domain from an email or URL column.

This logic already existed inside the `column-extract` drill; this pulls
it out as a top-level concept, since extractions are also being
integrated into the notebook editor apart from drills.

Part of the follow-up for Extract Column epic #38964.
author: bshepherdson
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

title: Exclude sample content and "Metabase Analytics" content from usage stats (clone)
body:
Clone of https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41519

Now that we're adding sample content to new instances in https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/40753, this PR excludes the content from usage stats. The relevant section of the product doc is [here](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Seed-new-instances-w-an-example-dashboard-18571f9ab18d41f882c39db92de3634d?pvs=4#070cfdadfdfb494cadf4e288a3764fd3):

> When sending [usage stats](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/778e5cdf6554a0b66943cb1291347b032158ef5e/src/metabase/analytics/stats.clj#L422), we should not include this sample content (or the audit v2 content) in any question/dashboards aggregates

It also excludes Metabase Analytics content (behaviour approved [here](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C063Q3F1HPF/p1713362797221789?thread_ts=1713202568.295799&cid=C063Q3F1HPF) by Arakaki)

Both changes the same approach: 
1. We now exclude any cards and dashboards that were created by the internal user from the stats. We also exclude any dashcards that belong to a dashboard that was created by the internal user.
2. We exclude any collections that have `is_sample=true` from the stats. This required creating a new `is_sample` column on the `collection` table.
author: calherries
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Increase timeout for with-dynamic-redefs test
body:
References https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41515

### Description

The test for `with-dynamic-redefs` is hitting its timeout once in a while, and I suspect its just due to thread contention when a large number of tests are run in parallel, and there's a lot of demand on the common thread pool. I doubt that garbage collection is playing a role here given the timeout is already fairly long.

Since `await` will return immediately once its thread is notified after the corresponding `countDown` call, increasing the timeout won't affects runtime for cases when it wouldn't have flaked, so this gives a generous wait time - it's still a bargain compared to rerunning the entire test suite.

In case it still flakes, this adds a bunch of debugging info too.

title: fix: border appearing on night theme if bordered=false
body: ### Description This was probably made by mistake and never noticed, the night theme is setting not only the border color but also a border width, so the border appears even when #bordered=false. If people want the border they can add it on the iframe so this shouldn't break anything [slack thread](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C063Q3F1HPF/p1713204621307759) ### How to verify Make a `#theme=night&bordered=false` dashboard embedding Notice that without this fix it has a 1px solid border (it's more visible on a dark page) ### Demo Before: After:

title: Add curate permissions for "All Users" for example collection
body: This PR adds "curate" permissions for "All Users" for example collection added in https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/40753. Previously only Admins had access. I decided to implement it in Clojure and not by adding more data to `resources/sample-content.edn`, because if we want to export another collection in the future the separation of content and permissions will make that process simpler. title: Links to metabase URLs should open in the same window in link cards
body:
Partially fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/30891

### Description

External link cards currently always opens in new tabs. When clicking on a link to metabase urls, such as `https://example.com/question/1-some-question`, it opens a new tab instead of opening in the same window. This makes the URL break out of embedding as well.

This PR makes it so links with the same origin or same as the site url open in the same window.

### Caveat

This also causes all relative links to open in the same tab. This would make relative links to questions and dashboards open correctly, but invalid relative links such as `example.com`, `www.example.com`, `foobar` will remain broken. An open question is how should we handle invalid relative links in external link cards.

### How to verify

- Create a new link card in a dashboard.
- Enter the absolute url to a metabase question or dashboard, e.g. `https://localhost:3000/dashboard/1-example`
- Click on the card, and it should open in the same page. Go back to the dashboard.
- Next, edit the card and enter a relative url to a metabase question or dashboard, e.g. `dashboard/1-example`
- Click on the card, and it should also open in the same page

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Split Data Perms UI - Bug Bash 2
body:
### Description

Fixes all the issues flagged in our second permissions bug bash. The most notable fixes:
- typos, smart quotes fixes, copy improvements
- link to docs is now correct
- handles downgrading EE to OSS still allowing user to edit values + tries to preserve the EE values as best as possible in case user upgrades again (also e2e tests for this)
- legacy no self-service in one row on OSS was causing the table render create queries values in the view data columns
- fixed OSS schema permissions page still showing view data column w/ no configurable values
- fixed issue where sandboxing a table w/o saving, then modifying the parent schema/database permission value and saving, was still saving the table as sandboxed
- hides legacy no self-service warning in OSS as the user can't migrate the value
- fix controlled create-queries values not getting warning if all users group was more permissive
- removes granular permissions warning for View data column changes

### How to verify

Given the number of changes.. I'm happy to help you repro anything via chat.


### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
maybe not exhaustive as they should be... feel free to push back on me here
author: sloansparger

title: [MBQL lib] Column Extract from URL, email requires regex support
body:
Not all drivers support regular expressions. Don't return the
Column Extractions for URL -> (sub)domain and email -> domain unless the
database can support the regular expression matches.

Part of the follow-up for Extract Column epic #38964.

title: fix combined cards tooltip
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41215

### Description

We were incorrectly using the series name in the tooltip for charts with combined cards, when we should have been using the column name.

We fix this by passing a boolean `hasCombinedCards` to, `getEventsColumnData`, and if it is true then we use the column name instead of the series name for the tooltip key.

### Demo

Before

![Screenshot 2024-04-16 at 12.06.44 PM.png](https://graphite-user-uploaded-assets-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/9ULpbAzGBtvQRyZEpGvu/cea7e286-1194-4091-82d2-9b618a48cc78.png)

After

![Screenshot 2024-04-16 at 12.01.00 PM.png](https://graphite-user-uploaded-assets-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/9ULpbAzGBtvQRyZEpGvu/9daf0a5a-8af4-4b3e-9652-65c7bc1aeb24.png)

title: [MBQL lib] Allow more filtering options for string PKs
body:
The filters for _numeric_ PK and FK filters are slightly different than a general numeric column. That's fine for numeric keys, but with string keys that same set of numeric filters was being returned, and then the ones for strings were removed. That left only `Is` and `Is Not` for a string PK or FK.

This PR allows more flexibility in filtering by string PKs and FKs, by checking the base type of the column and using the right set of filters for the type of key.

Closes #40665.
author: bshepherdson
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: Cancel statement on completion of `execute-reducible-query`
body:
Fixes #39018, #41448

This PR adds call to `.cancel` after `respond` completion in `metabase.driver.sql-jdbc.execute/execute-reducible-query`. 

That ensures statements are not in progress prior to `.close` calls of `with-open` of that function. In case statement was still in progress, the close call would block.

That situation could arise if `limit` (as per `metabase.query-processor.middleware.limit/limit-xform` middleware) takes the necessary results subset before statement has completed.

---

I do not add new tests for the change, as I believe it is overkill to check that query was actually canceled per every driver. That should be guaranteed by java driver implementation. Exception is handled for the case, where the method is not implemented by a java driver.
author: lbrdnk
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: fix time series chart is broken due to yyyymmdd numeric x-axis format
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41289 ### Description Fixes time series charts when for their x-values column contains numeric values in yyyymmdd format like `19210413` as numbers. We've been having our own parse timestamp function that uses moment `parseTimestamp` in `frontend/src/metabase/lib/time.ts`. Since we want to move away from moment and use dayjs all the code for the cartesian charts was using dayjs. So this PR introduces and uses the new `parseTimestamp` function based on dayjs. It required to include a missing in dayjs plugin `parseZone` which was implemented by the community but not yet got merged. ### How to verify Ensure the following x values are parsed as 13 April 1921 and 13 April 2021: ```sql select 19210413 x, 10 y union all select 20210413 x, 11 y ``` ### Demo ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Introduce `task` api using RTK Query and use it to replace `Tasks` entity
body:
### What does this PR accomplish?

Resolves https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40809

This PR introduces task-related API using RTK Query.
It started with the intention to re-wire the `Tasks` entity to use new endpoints under the hood, but ended up removing the entity altogether.

This was possible because I applied the RTK api directly in two places it was needed:
- TasksModal
- TasksApi

On top of that, I converted both these components to TypeScript.
And on top of that, I replaced the deprecated Tooltip with the Mantine Tooltip in TasksApp.

### Pagination
This PR is utlizing the work done in #41538, and it introduces a first RTK query that explicitly uses pagination:
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41452/files#diff-2d560c339614be77f0f396051e2c26fb8848dab2e630b2bf8fd8985ef1740e08R30-R33

### Demo
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/31325167/d6d2e212-0b50-4629-9bfe-841a64b361dc

### How to test?
CI should be green and relevant E2E tests must pass both locally and in CI.

title: fix incorrect axis title
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41285

### Description

Fixes the y-axis title being incorrect when there is a split. This is done by using the name of the series from the series model.

### Demo

![Screenshot 2024-04-15 at 2.11.26 PM.png](https://graphite-user-uploaded-assets-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/9ULpbAzGBtvQRyZEpGvu/03020ce1-ab38-44cd-83a0-641722598657.png)

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Embedding SDK - Fix table header styles calculation
body:
Relates to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41095, MS3 Also: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41106 ### Description This fixes table header styles calculation. The way how table header cells is calculated described here - https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/master/frontend/src/metabase/visualizations/components/TableInteractive/TableInteractive.jsx#L275 We mount a hidden div to **document.body**, render cells, calculate maximum width, and then apply this widths to real content. The issue is that we apply sdk styles overrides only inside our wrapper component scope, so globally mounted hidden div doesn't have needed svg styles which leads to wrong header cells width. ### How to verify Run demo, check table header. ### Demo
Before: After:
author: deniskaber

title: Remove Metadata schemas in lib.metadata and use the versions in lib.schema.metadata instead
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39334

### Description

Originally Malli schemas for MLv2 metadata like `ColumnMetadata` lived in `metabase.lib.metadata`, a while ago we moved them to `metabase.lib.schema.metadata` so they could live with all of the other MLv2 schemas. Now `ColumnMetadata` is a just a def for `::lib.schema.metadata/column`.

### How to verify

Run tests in `metabase.lib.metadata-test`

```sh
clojure -X:dev:test :only metabase.lib.metadata-test
```

EDIT: Addressed in #42070 (we only need to remove the remaining ;TODO commment
author: puchka
labels: [('External', 'PR from an external contributor.')]

When you're editing a dashboard and when you want to add a filter, there used to be 2 clicks: type of the filter and operator. With this PR we guess the default operator for a filter and keep only 1 click to create a filter.

Check commits to better understand the diff

title: revert dashcard border to put back transparency for transparent embed‚Ä¶
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41393 ### Description A border/shadow was changed in https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/36991/, more specifically [this line](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/36991/files#diff-215c69e998ee8317ed7048294524429bc439b581518f6aade1be56d4901a399bL34) sets the dashcards border to a color with 100% alpha. This makes embeds with the transparent theme on a colored/dark background look a lot different than before (uglier in most cases). This PR reverts that to address the complaints of some customers. ### How to verify 1. Create a dashboard 2. Do a static embed of it with theme=transparent 3. Notice that if embedded on a page with a dark color it looks better than without this pr ### Demo Before: After: I'm not touching the bottom border on the dashboard tabs as as far as I checked that never had transparency. Customers could complain about it popping up with titled=false and no tabs, making look like there's a top border, but that's been fixed with https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41399
author: npretto

title: [Cache] Schedule strategy follow up
body:
This PR puts the Selects on the right side of the schedule

Before:

![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/130925/9d9bacd5-2785-4f9a-8cf7-18ba28242cea)

After:

![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/130925/345b537f-b304-44c8-998f-9e7d2e854b30)

The word order is flexible, so the schedule localizes better. Here's a translation into German:

![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/130925/03c361cd-c577-475f-975d-cd11f244fe85)

If the instance has been set to 24-hour clock mode, that is respected:

![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/130925/8efe8a28-8a4a-49f1-b1bc-683e711a2feb)

Hovering over the timezone explains it:

![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/130925/e9d1f00d-d9ea-4c8b-bbd4-7508de2e6d3c)

Closes #41434

title: Fix `resources/sample-content.edn` (no such file or directory) error running jar
body:
Running the bulit uberjar from `build.sh` currently fails with the following error if you run the jar from outside the project directory:

```
[main] ERROR metabase.core - Metabase Initialization FAILED
liquibase.exception.CommandExecutionException: liquibase.exception.LiquibaseException: liquibase.exception.MigrationFailedException: Migration failed for changeset migrations/001_update_migrations.yaml::v50.2024-04-09T15:55:22::calherries:
     Reason: clojure.lang.ExceptionInfo: resources/sample-content.edn (No such file or directory) {:toucan2/context-trace [["resolve connection" {:toucan2.connection/connectable org.h2.jdbc.JdbcConnection}] ["resolve connection" {:toucan2.connection/connectable nil}]]}
```

This PR fixes the error by specifying the file as a resource rather than using a path relative to the current directory.

I tested the jar already in CI [here](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/8689336483).
author: calherries
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: fix header being rendered (with its border) on dashboard embedded with titled=false and only one tab
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41393 ### Description The issue seems to come from the bottom-border on the header, which is rendered even though there's only 1 tab and no title. `EmbedFrame` is rendering the header only when `Boolean(finalName || dashboardTabs)` https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/97ab5fa41482af0904cb7115f3e96ac7d9d6f921/frontend/src/metabase/public/components/EmbedFrame/EmbedFrame.tsx#L168-L168 The issue is that `dashboardTabs` it not the array of the tabs, but a component which is always truthy: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/2c21fa99a07e8445fbdb61ff6df93de14defe293/frontend/src/metabase/public/containers/PublicDashboard/PublicDashboard.jsx#L184-L186 I thought about making the component return null if there were no tabs, but I noticed on other places we do the check outside so I did the same here to stay on the safer side: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/97ab5fa41482af0904cb7115f3e96ac7d9d6f921/frontend/src/metabase/dashboard/containers/AutomaticDashboardApp.jsx#L155-L158 ### How to verify - Make a dashboard with one tab - do a static embed of it with `#theme=transparent&bordered=false&titled=false` - notice it renders the header, making look like the dashboard has a top border This should behave the same for public embeds ### Demo Before: After: ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Bump mysql2 from 3.6.3 to 3.9.4
body:
Bumps [mysql2](https://github.com/sidorares/node-mysql2) from 3.6.3 to 3.9.4.
Release notes

Sourced from mysql2's releases.

v3.9.4

3.9.4 (2024-04-09)

Bug Fixes

  • SSL: separate each certificate into an individual item #2542 (63f1055)
  • security: improve supportBigNumbers and bigNumberStrings sanitization (#2572) (74abf9e)
    • Fixes a potential RCE attack vulnerability reported by Vsevolod Kokorin (Slonser) of Solidlab
  • security: improve results object creation (#2574) (4a964a3)
    • Fixes a potential Prototype Pollution attack vulnerability reported by Vsevolod Kokorin (Slonser) of Solidlab
  • docs: improve the contribution guidelines (#2552) (8a818ce)

v3.9.3

3.9.3 (2024-03-26)

Bug Fixes

  • security: improve cache key formation (#2424) (0d54b0c)
    • Fixes a potential parser cache poisoning attack vulnerability reported by Vsevolod Kokorin (Slonser) of Solidlab
  • update Amazon RDS SSL CA cert (#2131) (d9dccfd)

v3.9.2

3.9.2 (2024-02-26)

Bug Fixes

  • stream: premature close when it is paused (#2416) (7c6bc64)
  • types: expose TypeCast types (#2425) (336a7f1)

v3.9.1

3.9.1 (2024-01-29)

Bug Fixes

  • types: support encoding for string type cast (#2407) (1dc2011)

v3.9.0

3.9.0 (2024-01-26)

Features

  • introduce typeCast for execute method (#2398) (baaa92a)

v3.8.0

3.8.0 (2024-01-23)

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from mysql2's changelog.

3.9.4 (2024-04-09)

Bug Fixes

  • docs: improve the contribution guidelines (#2552) (8a818ce)
  • security: improve results object creation (#2574) (4a964a3)
  • security: improve supportBigNumbers and bigNumberStrings sanitization (#2572) (74abf9e)

3.9.3 (2024-03-26)

Bug Fixes

  • security: improve cache key formation (#2424) (0d54b0c)
    • Fixes a potential parser cache poisoning attack vulnerability reported by Vsevolod Kokorin (Slonser) of Solidlab
  • update Amazon RDS SSL CA cert (#2131) (d9dccfd)

3.9.2 (2024-02-26)

Bug Fixes

  • stream: premature close when it is paused (#2416) (7c6bc64)
  • types: expose TypeCast types (#2425) (336a7f1)

3.9.1 (2024-01-29)

Bug Fixes

  • types: support encoding for string type cast (#2407) (1dc2011)

3.9.0 (2024-01-26)

Features

  • introduce typeCast for execute method (#2398) (baaa92a)

3.8.0 (2024-01-23)

Features

  • perf: cache iconv decoder (#2391) (b95b3db)

Bug Fixes

title: dc.js to echarts migration
body:
ECharts feature branch

### New features
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/33586
- Adds missing features to static line, area, bar, combo, waterfall charts such as goal lines, trend lines, formatting, axes types, normalized stacking and more 
- Adds static funnel bar chart support
- [Hide value labels belonging to other series when hovering on a series in the legend](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Hide-value-labels-belonging-to-other-series-when-hovering-on-a-series-in-the-legend-c85e9f43c6eb480c828df1327a5456a5) 

### Bug fixes
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/29836
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/30807
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/36850
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/30551
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/30325

- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/27942

- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/25896
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/23743
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/20559
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39178
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/36850
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/33626
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/33798
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/33705
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/30315
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/27963
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/32412
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/25597
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/11889
- https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/11968

### Tech Debt
- Remove the unmaintained `dc.js` dependency which limitations prevent us from building certain features such as stacked combo charts

title: [tech debt] Stop using ms/BooleanString and only use ms/BooleanValue
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39740

### Description

Solves #39740 ~~apart from the one in `src/metabase/api/native_query_snippet.clj`~~
The tests in `metabe.api.native-query-snippet-test` are ending with an error as reported in #41389
author: puchka
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('External', 'PR from an external contributor.')]

[{'comment_id': 2057482578, 'issue_id': 2242282377, 'author': 'puchka', 'body': "> Hi, thanks for your contribution.
> 
> The changes you've sent up look good, but I think we can make them even better by removing `BooleanString` entirely. And it won't take many more changes, either:
> 
>     * [x]  delete [this bit of this test](https://github.com/puchka/metabase/blob//test/metabase/util/malli/schema_test.clj#L60-L62)
> 
>     * [x]  remove [this last non-test usage](https://github.com/puchka/metabase/blob//src/metabase/api/native_query_snippet.clj#L24-L31) of ms/BooleanString
> 
>     * [x]  remove the [BooleanString schema def](https://github.com/puchka/metabase/blob//src/metabase/util/malli/schema.clj#L230-L235), since it will be unused then.

title: Adds missing `glue:GetCatalogImportStatus`
body:
### Description

Seems that `glue:GetCatalogImportStatus` is also needed for the integration with Amazon Athena because there's multiple AccessDenied on cloudtrail if this permission is missing:
```
{
    "eventVersion": "1.09",
    "userIdentity": {
        "type": "IAMUser",
        "principalId": "***********************",
        "arn": "arn:aws:iam::*************:user/metabase",
        "accountId": "**********************",
        "accessKeyId": "*******************",
        "userName": "metabase"
    },
    "eventTime": "2024-04-11T08:29:00Z",
    "eventSource": "glue.amazonaws.com",
    "eventName": "GetCatalogImportStatus",
    "awsRegion": "************************",
    "sourceIPAddress": "***********",
    "userAgent": "DriverVersion/02.00.35.1001/JDBCVersion/4.2/PluginName/IAM, aws-sdk-java/1.12.339 Linux/5.10.213-201.855.amzn2.x86_64 OpenJDK_64-Bit_Server_VM/11.0.22+7 java/11.0.22 clojure/1.11.1 vendor/Eclipse_Adoptium cfg/retry-mode/legacy",
    "errorCode": "AccessDenied",
    "errorMessage": "An unknown error occurred",
    "requestParameters": null,
    "responseElements": null,
    "requestID": "*************************************",
    "eventID": "*************************************",
    "readOnly": true,
    "eventType": "AwsApiCall",
    "managementEvent": true,
    "recipientAccountId": "*************************************",
    "eventCategory": "Management",
    "tlsDetails": {
        "tlsVersion": "TLSv1.3",
        "cipherSuite": "TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256",
        "clientProvidedHostHeader": "glue.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com"
    }
}
```

title: Add Kondo linter to disallow hardcoded driver names in tests
body:
Resolves #26807

Adds a linter to check for tests that hardcode driver names, and then fixes the ~110 tests that were breaking this rule. This is not enforced against `:h2` or in driver test namespaces e.g. `metabase.driver.postgres-test`

The fixes were done with the following strategies:

- For hardcoded driver names used to skip certain tests or restrict certain tests to a certain group of drivers, I defined new namespaced driver features and added appropriate implementations

- For hardcoded driver names for tests that return different results based on driver I added new multimethods next to those tests, for example `metabase.query-processor-test/relative-date-test/group-by-week-test-expected-rows`

- Some tests that had legitimate reasons for running against a specific hardcoded driver I added `:clj-kondo/ignore` with a comment about why I think ignoring the warning is ok here. I tried not to fall back to this unless there was a really good reason for doing so

- Some other tests against one specific driver were moved to appropriate driver test namespaces

As part of this project I split a bunch of big tests up into smaller tests to make it easier to add appropriate feature flags or expected-rows methods. Underlying test logic is unchanged however
author: camsaul
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/DevEx', '')]

', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 12, 20, 39, 49, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2091867594, 'issue_id': 2240856744, 'author': 'camsaul', 'body': 'I think https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/856b449/test/metabase/query_processor_test/timezones_test.clj#L250-L263 is the best way to tackle this going forward', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 5, 2, 22, 43, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2289243742, 'issue_id': 2240856744, 'author': 'camsaul', 'body': '@lbrdnk RE your notes > Lot of new methods. There is a pattern of defining new multimethod for test's query, rows. I have a feeling that introducing one multi, eg. `tx.test/aux` could make things simpler (eg. around tests like `yyyymmddhhmmss-dates`). Consider the following. Yeah, I don't really love having these methods at all honestly. Most of them are to work around SQLite being weird with it's datetime types. I think a better fix might be to just figure out how to eliminate the need for those methods as much as possible > Feature documentation. (1) Lot of features are added without documenting what those are used for. It would be imo easier for somebody looking at it for the first time to have some context as with features defined in `metabase.driver` ns. (2) If we don't have centralized def of those feature (even without doc), it makes it complicated to infer what driver supports. Right, since the new features are namespaces and next to the tests they are used I thought it's mostly self-documenting but for more general ones it would be good to put them in some sort of central location (maybe just `driver/features`) so there's a definitive list where people can go se what flags we understand. I still want to get this PR in since it's still a big improvement over the current state of things, but I'll open an issue to try to clean up feature flags a bit more going forward as a follow-on > "Bail out features". There are features defined so some tests could be skipped by some drivers. I understand having this option atm is necessary. I hope for the future where if driver is missing some other attribute to be able to run some test, it will be covered by check of another real feature `(something like (mt/test-drivers (apply disj (drivers-with-feat-to-be-tested) (drivers-missing-something-necessary-to-run-test))`. Yeah, I really don't like having "bail-out" features like these either, they're noisy and hacky and don't really help third-party driver authors if they need to skip a test we haven't created a feature for. Creating more general `:test/` features and eliminating the one-off features where possible or just fixing the skipped tests is a good next step > Developer docs. I think everybody who writes test using test-drivers should be on the same page on how we approach this. We should write this to our knowledge base. (Do we have something centralized?; I could help with this if desired/necessary.) This is a really good point. I don't think we really have any one good place where we write down things like this... talking about where documentation should live is something that has been on the agenda for BE guild sync for a while so it would be a good idea to come to a consensus on where we want it to live. Maybe markdown files that get included when you generate dox with Marginalia?', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 8, 14, 16, 26, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]

title: Split Data Perm UI - Product Iteration
body: Closes #41221 ### Description Makes three changes: 1. Adds warning above permissions table if a permission in the current view or within a nested entity contains the legacy No self-service (Deprecated) permission. 2. Adds a warning modal if the user is going to sandbox a table that we will need to remove native query permissions for all other tables/schemas for that group. 3. Adds a warning modal if the user is removing native query permissions for a single tables/schema that all other tables/schemas for that user will also have native query permissions removed. ### How to verify 1. Legacy Deprecation Notice - Have a permissions graph that has the `legacy-no-self-service` value in it. - Validate that you see this when the `legacy-no-self-service` value is present in the graph - Validate it's no longer than if you change the value 2. Sandboxing warning - Have a database with `Can view` and `Query builder and native` permissions - Make View data permissions granular - Change a table to be `Sandboxed`, see that you are properly warned. - Exit w/o sandboxing - Change database `Create queries` permissions to `Query builder only` - Make View data permissions granular - Change a table to be `Sandboxed`, see that you are not warned. 3. Granular create queries permissions warning - Have a database with `Can view` and `Query builder and native` permissions - Make Create queries permissions granular - Change a table to be `Query builder only` or `No`, see that you are properly warned. ### Demo 1. Legacy Deprecation Notice 2. Sandboxing warning 3. Granular create queries permissions warning ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: sloansparger
labels: [('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Notebook combine columns
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41178

### Description

Adds the combine column shortcut to the expression editor popover. 

A lot of the work here is duplicated from https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/40082. There will be a follow up PR to merge and refactor the code.

What this PR does _not_ do (yet):
- Add the shortcut to the expression suggestions, this work is tracked elsewhere: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41578

### How to verify

Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.

1. New question ‚Üí Sample Dataset ‚Üí Orders
2. Add custom column
3. Click the `Combine` button
4. Play around with the combine popover to generate different expressions

### Demo

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1250185/12666698-af16-4274-bd34-92b0e5ff95aa





### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Log errors fetching sync metadata
body:
This PR turns on error logging for the `metabase.sync.fetch-metadata` namespace to debug redshift flakes.

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41022 failed to give any insight into redshift flakes because the stack trace isn't being logged (not sure why). Rather than rely on a stack trace, this PR will help narrow it down by adding logging around each function that we use to fetch data for syncing metadata.

See [this failure](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/8661085895/job/23754004650?pr=41022#step:3:1523) for the current logs. All we get is this:

```
Caused by: com.amazon.redshift.util.RedshiftException: ERROR: relation "2024_04_12_042037a3_49ab_4d07_b91d_60f1d23007e1_schema.ejtaogiukqcpdrjxkvwd" does not exist
	at com.amazon.redshift.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.receiveErrorResponse(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2648) ~[redshift-jdbc42-2.1.0.26.jar:?]
	at com.amazon.redshift.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.processResultsOnThread(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2295) ~[redshift-jdbc42-2.1.0.26.jar:?]
	at com.amazon.redshift.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.access$000(QueryExecutorImpl.java:82) ~[redshift-jdbc42-2.1.0.26.jar:?]
	at com.amazon.redshift.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl$RingBufferThread.run(QueryExecutorImpl.java:3128) ~[redshift-jdbc42-2.1.0.26.jar:?]
```
author: calherries
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Use `fk-metadata` instead of `table-fk-metadata` everywhere
body:
In https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/38970 we introduced `metabase.driver/describe-fks`, and promised to remove `metabase.driver/describe-table-fks` in 52.

From the changelog:
```
The multimethod metabase.driver/describe-table-fks has been deprecated in favor of metabase.driver/describe-fks. metabase.driver/describe-table-fks will be removed in 0.52.0.
```

This PR preps for that switch by reducing the places `metabase.driver/describe-table-fks` is used to one function that makes the switch easy: `backwards-compatible-describe-fks`
author: calherries

title: Add INFO log for each table being fingerprinted
body:
This PR adds INFO-level logs per table being fingerprinted. These logs will help debug performance issues with fingerprinting, because you can correlate issues with specific tables being fingerprinted.

If you add `<Logger name="metabase.sync.analyze.fingerprint" level="INFO"/>` to the log4j2.xml file, you'll get these additional lines in your logs when syncing a table for the first time:
```
[clojure-agent-send-off-pool-7] INFO  metabase.sync.analyze.fingerprint - Fingerprinting 3 fields in table Table 17 ''PUBLIC.USERS''
[clojure-agent-send-off-pool-7] INFO  metabase.sync.analyze.fingerprint - Fingerprinting 12 fields in table Table 18 ''PUBLIC.PEOPLE''
[clojure-agent-send-off-pool-7] INFO  metabase.sync.analyze.fingerprint - Fingerprinting 5 fields in table Table 19 ''PUBLIC.REVIEWS''
[clojure-agent-send-off-pool-7] INFO  metabase.sync.analyze.fingerprint - Fingerprinting 8 fields in table Table 20 ''PUBLIC.ORDERS''
[clojure-agent-send-off-pool-7] INFO  metabase.sync.analyze.fingerprint - Fingerprinting 5 fields in table Table 21 ''PUBLIC.VENUES''
[clojure-agent-send-off-pool-7] INFO  metabase.sync.analyze.fingerprint - Fingerprinting 1 fields in table Table 22 ''PUBLIC.CATEGORIES''
[clojure-agent-send-off-pool-7] INFO  metabase.sync.analyze.fingerprint - Fingerprinting 7 fields in table Table 23 ''PUBLIC.PRODUCTS''
[clojure-agent-send-off-pool-7] INFO  metabase.sync.analyze.fingerprint - Fingerprinting 3 fields in table Table 24 ''PUBLIC.CHECKINS''
```
author: calherries
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Correct sync error handling in redshift tests
body:
When the `sync-database!` call in `redshift-lbv-sync-error-test` test fails in CI (usually due to a redshift flake) we don't get a helpful stack trace ([example failure](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/8635699680/job/23674074297#step:3:1169)). We get something like:
```
com.amazon.redshift.util.RedshiftException cannot be cast to class clojure.lang.Associative 
```

And it doesn't actually log any of the information in the exception. That's because our error handling for sync is broken and we're returning an exception here: 
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/df011566c6a9139fae4fb9ea2deb566f8e0020c9/src/metabase/sync/util.clj#L191-L195

Which causes the exception that is logged here:
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/df011566c6a9139fae4fb9ea2deb566f8e0020c9/src/metabase/sync.clj#L52

because we're trying to `assoc` with an exception.

Anyway even if the bug in sync code was fixed, this test should definitely be testing that there were no errors during sync.
So `*log-exceptions-and-continue?*` should be bound to false.
author: calherries
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Convert `legend.module.css` to CSS modules
body:
Closes #41354

### Description

Converts the remaining `legend.module.css` selectors to CSS modules. It looks like it's only used in `LegendItem`, `LegendVertical`, and `LegendHorizontal`. I also made sure that the more complicated selectors still made sense (i.e. the `DashCard` selector, which Denis thankfully already converted).

I did find that the use of two `LegendItem` components made things a little complicated, but I _think_ the components mentioned above are the only ones to use a `LegendItem` class. Let me know if I missed something

### How to verify

From what I understand, this Legend class is used in Pie and Choropleth visualizations. (`ChartWithLegend` uses `LegendVertical` and `LegendHorizontal`, which in turn use `Legend` and `Legend.module.css`). Just ensure that those visualizations work as expected.

(For choropleth, use the People table and use Summarize by `state`. This should give you a map with different colors depending on the number of people in each state.)
author: oisincoveney

title: Convert `formula.module.css` to CSS modules
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41347

### Description

Converts the `formula.module.css` file to CSS modules. This file is only used in the `Formula` component, and the only thing that really changes is the CSS transition classes (and one other small change).

I also converted this file to TS, and this PR is stacked on top of that one. Feel free to take a look so I can get both of them in relatively easily.

### How to verify

1. Create a metric and/or segment if you haven't already
2. Go to /reference/metrics and /reference/segment. Click into one of them
3. Click "View the [segment/metric] formula"
4. You should see that the transition to open the formula still works, and that the formula is displayed correctly.

Also tests should still pass

title: Add `Offset()` expression (BE + FE) (Part 1)
body:
Add `Offset()` expression so you can calculate month-over-month sales change percentage, rolling average of sales last 3 months, etc.


**Part 1: This PR only adds `Offset()` for use as a custom aggregate column for a query that has breakouts. Part 2 will add support for `Offset()` as a regular custom column with out any breakouts -- this is actually a lot trickier to get working.**

Resolves #5606
Resolves #8977 
Resolves #9393

Maybe resolves:

- #4257 
- #5817 
- #9170

![offset](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1455846/528adf17-8550-425f-b765-854154c806ee)

For the curious, right now the MBQL for `Offset()` looks like

```
[:offset <options-map> <expr> <n>]`
```

e.g.

```clj
[:offset {} [:sum {} [:field {} 1]] -1] ; sum(field_1) from previous row (row -1)
```

and is basically the same shape in both legacy MBQL and pMBQL (`expr` however will look a little different between versions).

QP code is set up to infer appropriate values automatically for the sort column and partition columns (using the same stuff for the window function versions of cumulative sum and cumulative count from #41340)

[Some of our tech design docs](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Tech-Time-over-time-comparison-faa8b285554a4a458e04cad84a3e7a47#0deb2dd3781447c29c13aa4153f0c09b) had options for explicitly specifying sort columns, sort directions, and partition columns, but I think the inferred behavior is what people will want in 99.9% of cases and it is simply not necessary to have those in there in order to let people solve issues that they actually want to solve, like month-over-month change in sales, or rolling average of total sales last 3 months, we don't need to specify different values for that stuff.

TODO: 

- [ ] We need to update documentation to mention this

Follow on PRs:

- [ ] Get `Offset()` working as a custom column with no breakouts
- [ ] Get this working for MySQL (fussy because it apparently doesn't like `lag()` or `lead()` if you have a `GROUP BY` at the same level)
author: camsaul
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

title: Improve echarts hovers
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40532

### Description

Preparation for fixing https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41217
Unfortunately, ECharts API does not provide emphasized/blurred state on axes which means we need to build axes part of the option object considering the `hovered` object. This PR prevents new hovered object creation while hovering the same datum which produces severe lags if we recomute the entire `option` every time `hovered` changes.

Also, this PR fixes a minor hover issue https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40532

And removes a slight lag which hurts performance due to unnecessary rerender:
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/14301985/6720881f-93ba-4d1d-8257-4eabde363971

### How to verify

To verify the `hovered` does not change when hovering the same datum you can
- add useEffect(() => { console.log(hovered) }, [hovered]) to `useChartEvents`
- create a bar chart
- move mouse within a single bar
- ensure there are no logs of the hovered when you move the cursor inside
author: alxnddr
labels: [('visual', 'Run Percy visual testing'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: Bugfix 37914 wrong filters UI in embedding
body:
Fixes: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/37914

Previously, we removed locked parameters entirely. This is to prevent leaking potentially sensitive values.

However, for the situation where the same field backs 1 locked or disabled paramter and 1 enabled parameter, we do
still want to send the paramater values, because the enabled parameter implies that the values are permissible to see
in the embed.

So, this change will still remove parameters based on their 'disabled/locked/enabled' status, but will NOT remove the
linked field ids if they're also being used by 'enabled' parameters.

This results in the backend correctly sending necessary parameter values to the embed, where the frontend can then
render the appropriate UI instead of falling back to just text filters.
author: adam-james-v
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]
