', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 5, 12, 53, 50, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2039945666, 'issue_id': 2223333616, 'author': 'npretto', 'body': "> If it's just forwarding couldn't the frontend just be calling store? Honest question, idk if that's a bad pattern in core. That was one solution on the table, but [when we discussed](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C063Q3F1HPF/p1711550919323269) how to not point to the prod endpoint when playing around with mb in dev mode, using an ENV from the BE seemed like the cleanest solution.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 5, 14, 27, 59, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2039951075, 'issue_id': 2223333616, 'author': 'piranha', 'body': "> If it's just forwarding couldn't the frontend just be calling store? Honest question, idk if that's a bad pattern in core. In service world (when you run something and not the others) it usually makes lots of sense to make frontend do everything possible through backend IMO, since it's much easier to control and understand. It's less important in a product like Metabase, but even that reason (dev vs prod) makes quite a bit of sense.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 5, 14, 30, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2040103233, 'issue_id': 2223333616, 'author': 'dpsutton', 'body': 'I think this could be a lot simpler. My thinking: - just put the function that makes a request in the api namespace. I don't think we need a new namespace to hold the one function. - have the endpoint always return `api/generic-204-no-content`. I don't think we really want to forward errors to the user. We just bulk collect stuff and move on - I'm interested to see what kind of error messages sending a null comment or a blank comment is. We might want custom checking instead of the automated type checking. Or maybe changing it to just a "string" and then throw a nice error message if it's blank. - The tests don't really do much, or assert a behavior that I'm not sure that we actually want. - The behavior that we care about really is that we forward the request with three bits of information. We should probably assert that, that we have some decent error messages, and if there's network problems we don't block or annoy the user.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 5, 15, 32, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2040170924, 'issue_id': 2223333616, 'author': 'dpsutton', 'body': 'I think a simpler version is this patch based on master: ```diff diff --git a/src/metabase/api/util.clj b/src/metabase/api/util.clj index 380cda08ee..7921e97ae0 100644 --- a/src/metabase/api/util.clj +++ b/src/metabase/api/util.clj @@ -2,6 +2,8 @@ "Random utilty endpoints for things that don't belong anywhere else in particular, e.g. endpoints for certain admin page tasks." (:require + [cheshire.core :as json] + [clj-http.client :as http] [compojure.core :refer [GET POST]] [crypto.random :as crypto-random] [metabase.analytics.prometheus :as prometheus] @@ -9,7 +11,10 @@ [metabase.api.common :as api] [metabase.api.common.validation :as validation] [metabase.logger :as logger] + [metabase.models.setting :refer [defsetting]] [metabase.troubleshooting :as troubleshooting] + [metabase.util.log :as log] + [metabase.util.malli :as mu] [metabase.util.malli.schema :as ms] [ring.util.response :as response])) @@ -38,6 +43,33 @@ [] {:token (crypto-random/hex 32)}) +(defsetting product-feedback-url + "URL for where to send product feedback" + :type :string + :default "https://store-api.metabase.com/api/v1/crm/product-feedback" + :visibility :internal) + +(mu/defn send-feedback! + [comments :- ms/NonBlankString + source :- ms/NonBlankString + email :- ms/NonBlankString] + (try (http/post (product-feedback-url) + {:content-type :json + :body (json/generate-string {:comments comments + :source source + :email email})}) + (catch Exception e + (log/warn e) + (throw e)))) + +(api/defendpoint POST "/product-feedback" + [:as {{:keys [comments source email]} :body}] + {comments ms/NonBlankString + source ms/NonBlankString + email ms/NonBlankString} + (future (send-feedback! comments source email)) + api/generic-204-no-content) + (api/defendpoint GET "/bug_report_details" "Returns version and system information relevant to filing a bug report against Metabase." [] diff --git a/test/metabase/api/util_test.clj b/test/metabase/api/util_test.clj index 5c8c583240..a917182098 100644 --- a/test/metabase/api/util_test.clj +++ b/test/metabase/api/util_test.clj @@ -1,7 +1,9 @@ (ns metabase.api.util-test "Tests for /api/util" (:require + [clojure.string :as str] [clojure.test :refer :all] + [metabase.api.util :as api.util] [metabase.test :as mt] [metabase.util.log :as log])) @@ -57,3 +59,24 @@ (mt/user-http-request :rasta :get 403 "util/diagnostic_info/connection_pool_info")))) (testing "Call successful for superusers" (is (map? (mt/user-http-request :crowberto :get 200 "util/diagnostic_info/connection_pool_info")))))) + +(deftest product-feedback-tests + (testing "requires non-blank comments, source, and email" + (doseq [missing [:comments :source :email]] + (let [payload {:comments "foo" :source "foo" :email "foo"} + response (mt/user-http-request :crowberto :post 400 "util/product-feedback" (dissoc payload missing))] + (testing (str "without " missing) + (is (= {:errors {missing "value must be a non-blank string."}, + :specific-errors {missing ["should be a string, received: nil" "non-blank string, received: nil"]}} + response)))))) + (testing "fires the proxy in background" + (let [sent? (promise)] + (with-redefs [api.util/send-feedback! (fn [comments source email] + (doseq [prop [comments source email]] + (is (not (str/blank? prop)) "got a blank property to send-feedback!")) + (deliver sent? true))] + (mt/user-http-request :crowberto :post 204 "util/product-feedback" + {:comments "I like Metabase" + :email "happy_user@test.com" + :source "Analytics Inc"}) + (is (true? (deref sent? 2000 ::timedout))))))) ``` I think this is far simpler, a few better tests, still easy to override the URL, and doesn't add extra files. Also, I checked what kind of errors we get from the ms/nonblankstring and they seem ok. I have tests about their shape and have an example here: ```shell ‚ùØ http post 'localhost:3000/api/util/product-feedback' x-api-key:$API_KEY -pb { "errors": { "comments": "value must be a non-blank string." }, "specific-errors": { "comments": [ "should be a string, received: nil", "non-blank string, received: nil" ] } } ```', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 5, 16, 2, 14, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2044518912, 'issue_id': 2223333616, 'author': 'WiNloSt', 'body': "I've reviewed it, but didn't have much opinion on the BE code. It's ok as long as it works for me.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 9, 9, 12, 49, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2048061423, 'issue_id': 2223333616, 'author': 'npretto', 'body': "Thank you @dpsutton and @camsaul ! I reverted my changes and started again from Dan's patch (It's on its own commit so you can see my diffs more easily). I changed a couple of things: - https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/40974/commits/0093d3c64ad961ca5810238f3a1e50b7c6e47a65 both email and comments are now optional, it was my mistake to mark comments at required - https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/40974/commits/6e342eb4e17a7a354f139e6a5cc7f885c3ea39f2 I set a `setter` on the setting to make it not point to prod on dev by default The second point is because I don't want us to send fake data points to the real endpoint accidentally, do you have better solutions to that? Not sure if the setting is still worth it as I still had to write the setter which is pretty much what could be a variable definition", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 10, 17, 3, 25, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]

(:require + [cheshire.core :as json] + [clj-http.client :as http] [compojure.core :refer [GET POST]] [crypto.random :as crypto-random] [metabase.analytics.prometheus :as prometheus] @@ -9,7 +11,10 @@ [metabase.api.common :as api] [metabase.api.common.validation :as validation] [metabase.logger :as logger] + [metabase.models.setting :refer [defsetting]] [metabase.troubleshooting :as troubleshooting] + [metabase.util.log :as log] + [metabase.util.malli :as mu] [metabase.util.malli.schema :as ms] [ring.util.response :as response])) @@ -38,6 +43,33 @@ [] {:token (crypto-random/hex 32)}) +(defsetting product-feedback-url + "URL for where to send product feedback" + :type :string + :default "https://store-api.metabase.com/api/v1/crm/product-feedback" + :visibility :internal) + +(mu/defn send-feedback! + [comments :- ms/NonBlankString + source :- ms/NonBlankString + email :- ms/NonBlankString] + (try (http/post (product-feedback-url) + {:content-type :json + :body (json/generate-string {:comments comments + :source source + :email email})}) + (catch Exception e + (log/warn e) + (throw e)))) + +(api/defendpoint POST "/product-feedback" + [:as {{:keys [comments source email]} :body}] + {comments ms/NonBlankString + source ms/NonBlankString + email ms/NonBlankString} + (future (send-feedback! comments source email)) + api/generic-204-no-content) + (api/defendpoint GET "/bug_report_details" "Returns version and system information relevant to filing a bug report against Metabase." [] diff --git a/test/metabase/api/util_test.clj b/test/metabase/api/util_test.clj index 5c8c583240..a917182098 100644 --- a/test/metabase/api/util_test.clj +++ b/test/metabase/api/util_test.clj @@ -1,7 +1,9 @@ (ns metabase.api.util-test "Tests for /api/util" (:require + [clojure.string :as str] [clojure.test :refer :all] + [metabase.api.util :as api.util] [metabase.test :as mt] [metabase.util.log :as log])) @@ -57,3 +59,24 @@ (mt/user-http-request :rasta :get 403 "util/diagnostic_info/connection_pool_info")))) (testing "Call successful for superusers" (is (map? (mt/user-http-request :crowberto :get 200 "util/diagnostic_info/connection_pool_info")))))) + +(deftest product-feedback-tests + (testing "requires non-blank comments, source, and email" + (doseq [missing [:comments :source :email]] + (let [payload {:comments "foo" :source "foo" :email "foo"} + response (mt/user-http-request :crowberto :post 400 "util/product-feedback" (dissoc payload missing))] + (testing (str "without " missing) + (is (= {:errors {missing "value must be a non-blank string."}, + :specific-errors {missing ["should be a string, received: nil" "non-blank string, received: nil"]}} + response)))))) + (testing "fires the proxy in background" + (let [sent? (promise)] + (with-redefs [api.util/send-feedback! (fn [comments source email] + (doseq [prop [comments source email]] + (is (not (str/blank? prop)) "got a blank property to send-feedback!")) + (deliver sent? true))] + (mt/user-http-request :crowberto :post 204 "util/product-feedback" + {:comments "I like Metabase" + :email "happy_user@test.com" + :source "Analytics Inc"}) + (is (true? (deref sent? 2000 ::timedout))))))) ``` I think this is far simpler, a few better tests, still easy to override the URL, and doesn't add extra files. Also, I checked what kind of errors we get from the ms/nonblankstring and they seem ok. I have tests about their shape and have an example here: ```shell ‚ùØ http post 'localhost:3000/api/util/product-feedback' x-api-key:$API_KEY -pb { "errors": { "comments": "value must be a non-blank string." }, "specific-errors": { "comments": [ "should be a string, received: nil", "non-blank string, received: nil" ] } } ``` WiNloSt on (2024-04-09 09:12:49 UTC): I've reviewed it, but didn't have much opinion on the BE code. It's ok as long as it works for me. npretto (Issue Creator) on (2024-04-10 17:03:25 UTC): Thank you @dpsutton and @camsaul ! I reverted my changes and started again from Dan's patch (It's on its own commit so you can see my diffs more easily). I changed a couple of things: - https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/40974/commits/0093d3c64ad961ca5810238f3a1e50b7c6e47a65 both email and comments are now optional, it was my mistake to mark comments at required - https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/40974/commits/6e342eb4e17a7a354f139e6a5cc7f885c3ea39f2 I set a `setter` on the setting to make it not point to prod on dev by default The second point is because I don't want us to send fake data points to the real endpoint accidentally, do you have better solutions to that? Not sure if the setting is still worth it as I still had to write the setter which is pretty much what could be a variable definition

title: [Cache] Add "Invalidate cache now" button
body:
Adds an "Invalidate now" button to the strategy form (in Admin settings > Performance). The button appears when a database is selected, unless the database's strategy is set to "No cached". The button invalidates the cache for the selected database.

Closes #41433

![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/130925/296ce521-ffcb-4f34-8aef-3ae1ed120202)

title: Fix flaky test caused by unmounted HoverCard
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39991

### Description

The problem occurred because somehow sometimes, the test would not unmount the [fake columns](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/359a8dacc6b656a83bc0709e66753a024514ea06/frontend/src/metabase/visualizations/components/TableInteractive/TableInteractive.jsx#L270) we used to measure the table size. And when that happened, `popover()` E2E util will find not only the open popover, but also `MetadataInfo/Popover` which has a different class `.mantine-HoverCard-dropdown` than what we exclude in that util `.emotion-HoverCard-dropdown`. I believe this is because we use `ReactDOM.render` and didn't render this under any provider that changes its prefix.

The fix is to change the way info dot popover works. Previously it will always mount, so the selector for `popover()` in our E2E tests would always find these info dots.

Since we only render these info dots when we hover over it, `popover()` won't find more than 1 element.


### How to verify

The main component changed is the `MetadataInfo/Popover` which is used in 3 places.
1. Table info dot > Browse a table > See the info dot beside the table name
1. Query column info dot > Browse a table > Hover over the column name
1. Table column info dot > Native query > Add a parameter and set it to Field Filter > Select a table > See the info dot beside any field

So, we need to verify that those 3 HoverCard still works as expected by hover over it and see if clicking inside the hover card should not close it.

### Demo
1. QueryColumnInfoPopover
    ![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/23ce2127-dc3f-46d6-91eb-9b7198fd7060)
1. TableColumnInfoPopover
    ![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/de84e536-49f4-4a91-aa5f-56a9cb621871)
1. TableInfoPopover
    ![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/31fd48af-aaea-449e-b56b-600d8a978e59)


### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR


### Note
- I didn't backport this because the [original PR that introduced `MetadataInfo/Popover`](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/39296) isn't backported.
- [Stress test result](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/8541267532) 20/20 ‚úÖ
author: WiNloSt
labels: [('flaky-test-fix', ''), ('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]
